result.execSummary:
The defendant Shaun G Rosewitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shaun G Rosewitz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shaun G Rosewitz was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
No violent contact with anyone.
Domestic abuse assessment.
Not to be present on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol. (taverns, bars or liquor stores)
Provide DNA Sample if not already provided.

Agent grants early discharge for supervision.
From DOC dated 8/19/16 re recommendation of early termination of probation with supporting documents.
from Cornerstone Counseling filed by Defense
filed by the State
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Shaun G Rosewitz in court with attorney Roger C. Pyzyk.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 1 dismissed and read-in. Ct. 3 dismissed outright.  Lisa R. (defendant's wife) made statements. 

Court orders the following:
Ct. 2: 
- Withheld sentence for 2 years Probation
- Court Costs of $343.00 (includes DV Surcharge) to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety.   Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling deemed appropriate. No violent contact with anyone. Domestic abuse assessment. No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 8, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel
Request granted.  Matter to be rescheduled.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Shaun G Rosewitz in court with attorney Roger C. Pyzyk.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting another date 2-3 weeks out. Defense has not received a final pretrial offer yet. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shaun G Rosewitz in court with attorney Roger C. Pyzyk.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests another date. This matter is almost resolved. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on September 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shaun G Rosewitz in court with attorney Roger C. Pyzyk.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Pyzyk requests a status date in 30 - 45 days. State is still in the process of reviewing the file. Parties also need to meet and discuss this matter. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on August 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shaun G Rosewitz in court with attorney Roger C Pyzyk.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Arraignment scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on June 30, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Lisa R. or any family member.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.
